title: Audrey Ei-Ping Lim | Web Directory | Singapore Institute of Technology
text_lines: This question is for testing whether or not you are a human visitor and to prevent automated spam submissions.
Masters in Sports Physiotherapy, University of South Australia, Australia

Merit Award for Best Oral Presenter at 14th Asia Pacific Medical Education Conference (APMEC) 2017.  Lim E.P.A., Soh S. (2017) Can Physiotherapy Standardised Patient Program Be A Comparable Substitute For The Traditional Clinical Education Model
Team Leader. Awarded Gold at Singapore Team Excellence Awards 2017 (National Innovation & Quality Awards)
Nanyang Polytechnic Innovation & Quality (IQ) Team Gold Award for Physiotherapy Standardised Patient Program (PSPP)
Merit Award for e-poster presentation at 13th Asia Pacific Medical Education Conference (APMEC) 2016.  Lim E.P.A., Soh S. (2016) Standardised Patients as Part of Physiotherapy Clinical Education.
Granted patent for ‘Compensation Aware Rehabilitation Method and System for Movements of Upper Limb’ (10201500514V)
‘Attachable and Foldable Seat (e-rest)’ commercialised by Easy Wheel Services and Trading
Granted patent for ‘Attachable and Foldable Seat (e-rest)’ (ID147)
Shortlisted for Tan Kah Kee Young Inventors Award
Singapore Ministry of Defence Star Service Award
Outstanding UWMS (Unit WITS Management System) Leader (Gold)
Ministry of Defence Overseas Scholarship (Defence Training Award)
American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM) – Level II Certification
Registered Physiotherapist, Allied Health Professional Council (AHPC), Singapore
Allied Health Ethics Educator (National Ethics Capability Committee and NUS Centre for Biomedical Ethics)
Appointed as a Specialist Singapore International Volunteer by Singapore International Foundation for expertise in physiotherapy curriculum development.
Judge and guest speaker at Singapore International Physiotherapy Congress 2016
Session Chair for World Confederation for Physical Therapy (WCPT) 2015, Singapore
28th Southeast Asian Games volunteer, Medical Services, Physiotherapist
Course Manager (Physiotherapy)/Senior Lecturer, Nanyang Polytechnic, Singapore
Member of Singapore Sports Institute (SSI) Medical Advisory Committee
1st Youth Olympic Games volunteer, Medical Services
Appointed member of Allied Health Credentials Evaluation Panel for Physiotherapy
Examiner for Ministry of Health (MOH) Qualifying Examinations
Head Physiotherapist, Ministry of Defence, Singapore Armed Forces
21st Southeast Asian Games volunteer, Medical Services, Physiotherapist
Physiotherapist for Singapore National Team - Soccer (Men)

Lim E.P.A., Soh S. (2017). Can Physiotherapy Standardised Patient Program Be A Comparable Substitute For The Traditional Clinical Education Model In The Preparatory Phase Of Clinical Training? Transactions of ISATE:The 11th International Symposium on Advances in Technology Education 2017;836-846.
Lim A, Li KM, Chui JY JM, Lim HY, Ong CL R (2011)Trunk Muscles Activation In Different Sitting Postures During Abdominal Hollowing Exercise.
Proceeding of 2nd Singapore Health and Biomedical Congress 2011.Abstract published in Annals of the Academy of Medicine.
Lim EPA, Rajaratnam BS, Lee AYY, Choo PL, Wang SSH, Tay MA (2009). Association Between Functional And Laboratory Test To Determine Dynamic Postural Ankle Instability.
Proceeding of 8th Annual Scientific Congress 2009. Published Annals: Academy of Medicine. Vol; 38 supplement 10 October 2009.
